Mailing.ContentText:
You are receiving this e-mail from Business Intelligence Solutions, as a business contact record in the {{description}}. If you choose to no longer receive Business Intelligence Solutions emails in the future, please see the instructions below. ******************************************************************* Because we are concerned with your privacy related to email marketing, it is important that Business Intelligence Solutions receives your permission to send you business related product and service announcements via e-mail. Any information you receive via email will be reviewed so that it is relevant to you as a business professional. This exciting new service will provide product and service announcement e-mails that highlight relevant offers such as:
- Business publications - Software - Computer and network related products - Trade Shows/Seminars - Webinars
At any time you will have the option to be removed from the BIS list. E-mail broadcasts will be controlled completely through a secure and authorized service bureau, and at no time will your email address be released to any third party company.
If you would like to receive relevant business information via e-mail from Business Intelligence Solutions you do not have to respond to this email. However, if you would prefer to no longer receive these email messages, please use the link at the bottom of the message to be removed.
Thank you for your time, Business Intelligence Solutions

Mailing.Subject: TEST MAILING Business Information Services for Executives

Mailing.ContentHtml:
To view this email as a webpage, click here.

Home | Contact | Distributors | Place an order
February 2011
Cathepsin Detection

There are approximately a dozen members of the cathepsin family, which are distinguished by their structure, catalytic mechanism, and which proteins they cleave. Most of the members become activated at the low pH found in lysosomes. Thus, the activity of this family lies almost entirely within those organelles. Cathepsins have been implicated in several diseases, including cancer, stroke, Alzheimer's disease, arthritis, COPD, chronic periodontitis, and several ocular disorders (keratoconus, retinal detachment, age-related macular degeneration, and glaucoma).

Magic Red™ Cathepsin Detection kits are fluorescent substrate-based assays used to monitor the activity of cathepsin proteases over time. They offer a clear picture of protease-positive versus protease-negative cells. ICT offers kits for the detection of three Cathepsins:

  • Cathepsin B  - Magic Red™ Cathepsin B detection kits are based on the  fluorogenic substrate MR-(Arg-Arg)2 or MR-(RR)2. This cathepsin B preferred peptide targeting sequence can enable the detection of cathepsin B enzyme activity in whole, living, and intact cells. (read more)
  • Cathepsin K  - Magic Red™ Cathepsin K detection kits are based on the fluorogenic substrate MR-(Leu-Arg)2 or MR-(LR)2 and provide a mechanism to monitor the varying constitutive levels of generalized cathepsin K enzyme activity in whole, living cells. (read more)
  • Cathepsin L  - Magic Red™ Cathepsin L detection kits are based on the fluorogenic substrate MR-(Phe-Arg)2 or MR-(FR)2, and enable the detection of cathepsin L enzyme activity in living and intact cells. (read more)

 
Jurkat cells incubated with MR-RR(2) (included in kits #937 and #938) and Hoechst nuclear stain reveal cathepsin B activity and nuclear morphology upon examination by CytoViva fluorescence microscopy.  Magic Red optimally excites at 540nm and emits above 610nm.


Cathepsin Classification
Cathepsin Classification                  Cathepsin Classification
Cathepsin A Serine Protease   Cathepsin H Cysteine Protease
Cathepsin B Cysteine Protease   Cathepsin K Cysteine Protease
Cathepsin C Cysteine Protease   Cathepsin L1 Cysteine Protease
Cathepsin D Aspartyl Protease   Cathepsin L2 (or V)  Cysteine Protease
Cathepsin E Aspartyl Protease   Cathepsin O Cysteine Protease
Cathepsin F Cysteine Protease   Cathepsin S Cysteine Protease
Cathepsin G Serine Protease   Cathepsin W Cysteine Protease
      Cathepsin Z (or X) Cysteine Protease

Magic Red™
Magic Red™ is ImmunoChemistry Technologies' proprietary cresyl violet (CV) fluorophore. We offer several kits with this detection system, including Caspase 3 & 7, Cathepsin B, Cathepsin K, and Cathepsin L. Our Magic Red™ Kits are well cited in many peer-reviewed scientific papers.
FLUORESCENT DETECTION AGENTS
APOPTOSIS DETECTION
ELISA SOLUTIONS
CUSTOM LAB SERVICES
NEW PRODUCTS
PLACE AN ORDER

Mailing.ContentText:
***** Exclusive Analyst Research ***** Forrester Research ----------------------------------------------------------
The Seven C's of Web Content Management Expand your WCM Strategy Beyond Just Managing Content
Written by Stephen Powers, Principal Analyst Forrester Research, Inc. - February 2, 2011
The web content management (WCM) market is currently experiencing a significant evolution as requirements for those platforms have grown beyond just managing web content. Instead, organizations need WCM to help support rich, contextual, engaging, cross-channel experiences. The growth of new content types, the emergence of new channels, and the increased expectations of customers all drive this significant change in WCM.
** COMPLIMENTARY ANALYST RESEARCH ** ==== http://www.ektron.com/campaigns/market-research/forrester-7cs-of-wcm/?cc=emwda000270 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Read this complimentary market report and learn why the "C" in WCM no longer stands for just content. The Seven C's of Web Content Management now include:
* Content * Context * Channel * Consistency * Community * Consumer Behavior * Creation
============================================================================================ Download Your FREE Copy Now! http://www.ektron.com/campaigns/market-research/forrester-7cs-of-wcm/?cc=emwda000270 ============================================================================================
This analyst report is Compliments of Ektron, Inc. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ About Ektron Ektron is a web solutions provider focused on web content management, marketing optimization, intranet, social, and mobile solutions built on a foundation software platform, Ektron CMS400.NET.
Learn more about Ektron's WCM Platform: http://www.ektron.com/campaigns/wcm/?cc=emwda000270 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ektron, Inc . 542 Amherst Street . Nashua, NH 03063 . +1 (866) 4-EKTRON . info@ektron.com
If you do not want to receive emails from Ektron, please send an email to optout@ektron.com

The Seven C's of Web Content Management
Expand your WCM Strategy Beyond
Just Managing Content
by Stephen Powers, Principal Analyst
Forrester Research, Inc. - February 2, 2011

The web content management (WCM) market is currently experiencing a significant evolution as requirements for those platforms have grown beyond just managing web content. Instead, organizations need WCM to help support rich, contextual, engaging, cross-channel experiences. The growth of new content types, the emergence of new channels, and the increased expectations of customers all drive this significant change in WCM.

Read this complimentary market report and learn why the "C" in WCM no longer stands for just content. The Seven C's of Web Content Management now include:

  • Content
  • Context
  • Channel
  • Consistency
  • Community
  • Consumer Behavior
  • Creation
Download Your FREE Copy Now!
